result.execSummary:
The defendant Jmontae L Bogan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically cognitive intervention. Must get high school diploma or HSED. A GED is not acceptable. No contact with any of the named co-defendants or with the victim. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

CORRECTED 04-27-2017 TO GRANT DEFENDANT CFTS

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in court with attorney Gregory Reed.  Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
The State files amended information in 15CF487. Upon pl to amended charge, parties stipulate to 4 yrs WPS bifurcated as 2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES. 15CF950 is DRI. 15CF1871, upon pl to Ct 3, the State recommends a w/held sentence - 3 yrs prob.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Plea hearing on October 31, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in court with attorney Gregory Reed.  Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Matter on the calendar today because the defendant had a change of heart based upon the implications of the agreement. The State indicates they still intend to amend the information. When the defendant changed his mind, the State was allowed to withdraw the information. The State proposes to amend information to attempted armed robbery.  

Defense makes speedy trial request

BTC: Amended information may be filed by the State and the process of filing the amended info/entering the plea to the amended charges will be completed on MH date.  Jury trial scheduled for November 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on September 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in court with attorney Gregory Reed.  Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in custody.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
In 15CF487, the State amends the charge to attempted Robbery, PTAC and recommends 4 yrs WPS equal bifurcation - this is a stipulated agreement. 15CF950 is DRI. In 15CF1871, the defendant will plead to Ct 3. Cts 1 & 2 are DRI. The State recommends 3 yrs probation. The State stands silent on expungement.
P-
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same

Defense now indicates that he neglected to discuss some information with his client and asks for time do to so. Time was given by the Court

back on the record: defense now indicates defendant no longer wishes to change his plea but wishes to take the matter(s) to trial. The State withdraws amended information.

BTC: STC to be set  Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in court with attorney Gregory Reed.  Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in custody.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for Robert Repischak for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Mr. Repischak will be ready to go on this, however, there is a Miranda/Goodchild motion and motion to amend information that hasn't been heard yet.

BTC: The Court will conduct Miranda/Goodchild prior to voir dire. The Court takes no action regarding motion to amend information at this time. JT remains

Preliminary hearing at 12-23-2015 09:00 am

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with the co-defendant, JH. Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court and meeting w/his Atty.   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in court with attorney Keith David O'Donnell.  Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in custody.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.
